headline: Unpaid internship, basically doing deal sourcing
pros: Have access to some real-world cases.
cons: Pretty much deal sourcing work, no related to technical finance.

headline: Good Opportunity to Learn About the Financial Industry
pros: Learnt a lot about this industry and got good practices by attending meetings and communicating with lead bankers
cons: Relatively low compensation and salary

headline: An honest review
pros: The company allows each intern to work right from deal generation to deal execution rather than just generating and passing on the leads to the seniors.
cons: The management does not encourage any formal or informal interaction between the co-workers.

headline: Marketing Specialist
pros: Technology based investment bank understanding.
cons: I do not have any right now. They provide whatever we need in the company. Good standarts and better enviroment.

headline: I Interned their for 3 months, and it most definitely is NOT A SCAM!!!!
pros: Honestly a great learning opportunity. You will learn a lot about Investment Banking, M&A, and develop communication skills.  You get experience with financial valuation and modeling.  Job is mostly remote (had the opportunity to meet the CEO in New York a few times) which is nice. You can even get college credit, as well as OPT and CPT for international students.  The pay was commission base, with a bonus.
cons: Work can get a little repetitive.
